result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Travis J Erickson was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any sentence currently serving.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's remaining confinement time converted to Extended Supervision
Matthew Gerber, Black River Fals Correctional with request for remaining confinement converted to Extended Supervision
Of JOC sent to defendant at Kettle Moraine.  Resent to street address.
Transcript of September 24, 2015 sentencing hearing filed by court reporter Cheryl J. Sisco

Defendant Travis J Erickson  #626105 in court, in custody with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 14CM442 and 14CF356.  Quash warrant.  In 14CF356  waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over. Information filed.  Reading waived.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest to Ct. 1.  Court found guilty. Judgment was entered.  Ct. 2 dismissed. Court sentenced defendant on Ct. 1 to serve 5 years in WI prison system, consecutive to any other sentence currently serving.  2 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision.  Conditions of extended supervision include:  $65.00 blood draw fee, $3468.00 fines and costs,  $250.00 surcharge if no sample has been previously posted and submit DNA sample if not previously submitted, AODA and comply, 36 month DL revocation, 36 month IID upon licensure, not to possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  14CM442 dismissed.  Defendant is eligible for the substance abuse program, not eligible for challenge incarceration program.  4 days credit.  Bond on hand will be applied towards costs and fines.
with Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus to Kettle Moraine Correctional Institution for 10-08-15 at 9:00 am.
